text: I am trying to create a schedule class in python that takes the start time, end time, and location of a meeting.

code:
class Schedule(Time):
def __init__(self, start_time, end_time, location):
    self.start_time = start_time
    self.end_time = end_time
    self.location = location
    print (self.start_time)
    print (self.end_time)
    print (self.location)

text: I have a Time class completed which looks like this:

code:
class Time():
    def __init__(self, init_hr = 12, init_min = 0, init_ampm = "AM"):
        self.hr = init_hr
        self.min = init_min
        self.ampm = init_ampm

text: Now I want to be able to make the parameters start_time and end_time (from the initialization of schedule) to be Time instances, however I'm confused on how I would go about doing that.
